alert.note: Alert for North Laramie Range; Shirley Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 2:00PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Albany County through 230 PM MDT... At 200 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles south of Little Medicine School, or 45 miles southwest of Douglas, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Albany County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
